alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:52PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mecklenburg, Lunenburg and southwestern Brunswick Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong gust front along a line extending from near Dundas to near Rehoboth to near Wylliesburg. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Locations impacted include... South Hill, Chase City, Victoria, Kenbridge, Brodnax, Brunswick, Lunenburg, La Crosse, Boydton, Kells Corner, Rehoboth, Bacons Fork, Wilburn, Spanish Grove, Gills Corner, Beechwood, Arvins Store, Bowens Corner, Finchley and Finneywood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with this gust front. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central Virginia.
